tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: Almost correct. An expression like "shooting the breeze" is certainly figurative in that it should not normally be understood literally, but in this question we are more interested in the fact that we cannot guess the meaning of the whole expression, simply from the meanings of the individual words "shooting" and "breeze".
Note quite! Something that is nonsensical has no conventional meaning, but "shooting the breeze" certainly does have a conventional meaning.
